intro: Walleria mackenziei, commonly known as the Mackenzie walleria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Walleria mackenziei is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
